thread.title: Lady Gaga and Elton John call each other 'daddy E' and 'soul daughter'
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga and Elton John call each other 'daddy E' and 'soul daughter'

title: Lady Gaga and Elton John call each other 'daddy E' and 'soul daughter'
text:
Lady Gaga and Elton John call each other 'daddy E' and 'soul daughter' Lady Gaga and Elton John call each other 'daddy E' and 'soul daughter' 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Lady Gaga and Sir Elton John have teamed up for Billboard magazine’s philanthropy edition – and it seems they have a father-daughter relationship. 
In an Instagram snap, Elton wrote: “Honoured to be sharing the cover of Billboard’s Philanthropy Issue with my soul daughter Gaga.” 
And in her own Instagram post, Gaga said: “Thank u Billboard for putting me and daddy E on the cover together,” adding: “We really care and I learn so much from him every day.” 
The magazine shines a light on the two singers and their charity work. 
Gaga, 29, discusses saving troubled teens with her Born This Way Foundation, while Elton, 68, talks about his Elton John Aids Foundation. 
In an opinion piece for the magazine, he wrote: “The music industry has the unique abilities to unite people and to inspire profound social change. That’s why I’m so honoured to participate in Billboard’s first philanthropy issue. 
“Through the years, I’ve done my best to use the incredible platform that I’ve been blessed with to make a difference, particularly in the fight against Aids.” 
On the cover, Gaga tenderly frames Elton’s head with her hands, while both look straight at the camera. The picture is in black and white, with the headline underneath reading: “We can be heroes.” 
The two have been close for some time – last year Gaga revealed that Elton “saved” her from a two-year drug battle. 
She told the Sun: “It’s pretty messed up being friends with people who used to have drug and alcohol problems, like Elton. 
“He got me on the straight and narrow. He was telling me ‘Gaga, you’re smoking too much’. He saved me.” Share article Lady Gaga and Elton John (Jason DeCrow/AP) Promoted Stories
